What is the  difference between window.onload and the jQuery $(document).ready() method?
choices: window.onload method occurs after all the page elements have loaded(HTML, CSS, images), which can result in a delay and $(document).ready() method begins to run code as soon as the Document Object Model (DOM) is loaded, which should be faster and less prone to loading errors

interview.question: What is the difference between setInterval() and setTimeout() functions?
choices: setTimeout() will only execute the function once after the specified amount of time and setInterval() executes everytime after specified interval is done
both do same stuff, can be used interchangeably
setInterval() doesn't take function as a parameter, setTimeout() takes function as parameter
setInterval accepts a function and millisecons, setTimeout only accepts function
